definitions.definition: To shut away for private discussion.
examples: The ambassador has been closeted with the prime minister all afternoon. We're all worried what will be announced when they exit.

definitions.definition: To put into a private place for a secret interview or interrogation.
To shut up in, or as in, a closet for concealment or confinement.

main_definition: ( transitive ) To shut away for private discussion.
secondary_definitions: ( transitive ) To put into a private place for a secret interview or interrogation.
( transitive ) To shut up in, or as in, a closet for concealment or confinement.
